app_url_local.title: App Url Local
app_url_local.description: To get this information, open Homebridge App under Hubitat UI, and tap on 'View Generated Config for HomeBridge'

app_url_cloud.title: App Url Cloud
app_url_cloud.description: To get this information, open Homebridge App under Hubitat UI, and tap on 'View Generated Config for HomeBridge'

use_cloud.title: Use Cloud Endpoint instead of local?
use_cloud.description: This will enable the plugin to communicate with the hubitat app via the cloud url.  (Mostly useful for troubleshooting local communication issues via ports)

app_id.title: App ID
app_id.description: To get this information, open Homebridge App under Hubitat UI, and tap on 'View Generated Config for HomeBridge'

access_token.title: App Token
access_token.description: To get this information, open Homebridge App under Hubitat UI, and tap on 'View Generated Config for HomeBridge'

direct_port.title: Direct Port
direct_port.description: This is the port that the plugin will listen on for traffic from your hub. Make sure your firewall allows incoming traffic on this port from your hub's IP address. (This is now a dynamic port selection)

polling_seconds.title: Polling Seconds}
polling_seconds.description: This is defines how often the plugin will poll the hub on it's own for updated devices and states (This is only used to just make sure everything is in sync state wise.  More than once every hour is not recommended)

adaptive_lighting_offset.title: Adaptive Lighting (ColorTemp in Mired) Offset
adaptive_lighting_offset.description: For example supplying a value of -10 will reduce the ColorTemperature, which is calculated from the transition schedule, by 10 mired for every change.

consider_fan_by_name.title: Assign Device as Fan when Device has the word Fan in the Name?
consider_fan_by_name.description: By default the plugin will identify a fan device by using a devices label, and whether it has Fan in the label.

consider_light_by_name.title: Assign Device as Light when Device has the word Light in the Name?
consider_light_by_name.description: By default the plugin will not identify a Light device by using a devices label, and whether it has Light in the label.

validateTokenId.title: Validate App Endpoint Access Token and AppID?
validateTokenId.description: This will help make sure your plugin is receiving data from the correct Hubitat App if you have multiple instances of the App.

debug.title: Enable debug logging?
debug.description: This will show just about every log output available.

showChanges.title: Show device events in the log output?
showChanges.description: This will log device event changes received by Hubitat.
